name: NUS SDS Data Visualisation Competition
description: Our team finished second place among 40 teams in a competition about finding out popular music trends from the 1980s
Given a dataset of musical attributes, our team utilised k-Means clustering to group songs into genres
We then created a variety of data visualisations using the results from the analysis
Came up with a data-driven infographic and gave a presentation to a panel of judges

name: Micron Business Analytics Case Competition
description: Our team finished second place among 150 teams in a competition organised by Micron
We came up with a forecast using time series analysis based on historical usage trends of the materials
Given a set of constraints to the production, our team also utilised advanced optimisation algorithms to come up with one of the top-performing production plans
Our solution has managed to return one of the highest profit after following all the constraints
